website_summaries.verdict: The photo quality you get from the EOS 6D makes it well worth the upgrade over a consumer APS-C model, but between this and comparable or higher-end models it's a less obvious choice.
pros: The Canon EOS 6D delivers the photo and video quality you expect from a full-frame sensor, in a well-designed and relatively lightweight body
cons: While the camera has nice extra features, like Wi-Fi and GPS support, it's missing some basics for the price like on-camera flash, multiple card slots, and a 100 percent-coverage viewfinder

customer_reviews.title: and I was always a bit disappointed with its image quality

The 6D has proven to be the perfect upgrade for me. customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Full Frame Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am an avid photographer and have owned a series of Canon cameras going back to film. Since going digital I really yearned for the ability to take wide angle photos again so I decided to I purchased a full frame digital camera. The 6D seemed like the perfect choice. I love this camera. It takes fantastic pictures. Has all the right features. I particularly like the relatively small size (compared to other full frame cameras). customer_reviews.author: Arnie Grever

customer_reviews.title: Forever a Canon lover.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is like my baby. I have two of them, after dropping one and breaking the screen (it will be repaired by Canon eventually). The ISO support on this beauty is magical. I can shoot in near complete darkness and retain a usable image. It's easy to use and fits comfortably in my hand. I prefer this to the 5D Mark III for ease of use. The lower number of focus points doesn't bother me at all. The silent shutter mode on this is pretty phenomenal too. Great for shooting events like weddings or ceremonies when you need to be quiet, or for photographing sleeping babies or wildlife. Highly, highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for amazing pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: 1000 dollars well spent.
customer_reviews.text: This camera was my upgrade from a rebel t3. Much better at low light situations. I have used this camera for a wedding ( with manual controls) and I was able to get get sharp photos using only the center focusing point. I have the custom controls set up to hold "set" for ISO controls, aperture is outer spinning wheel where the "set" button is. These are fast controls for basic adjustments. The photos are very sharp when pixel peeping in lightroom. The weight is very manageable to carry for a few hours. I like the way it feels in my hands. I've done macro, stock photography, portraits, home interior, and telephoto nature.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolute beast of a full frame Canon.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely adore this camera. It's value for the money is astounding. The controls and ergonomics are a perfect fit for me. I find myself most of the time with the Tamron 35mm 1.8 vc on my 6D. This combination is magical and versatile. Believe it or not, the first photo is taken with this lens. My second photo is what my favorite combination looks like in whole.

But if twice the price is worth that to you....get the mark iii. As for me, I'd been living with only one type of storage already, and I just couldn't justify spending twice as much for a difference. So I bought this and got a lens all for the same price as the mark iii and I'm much happier!!

product_meta.description: Style:Body Only| Configuration:BaseThe compact and lightweight EOS 6D full-frame digital SLR camera features a 20.2 Megapixel Full-Frame CMOS sensor, a wide ISO range of 100–25600, expandable to L: 50, H1: 51200, and H2: 102400, for incredible image quality even in low light, and a DIGIC 5+ Image Processor. The camera also has a new 11-point AF including a high-precision center cross-type AF point with EV -3 sensitivity, continuous shooting up to 4.5 fps, and Full HD video with manual exposure control, multiple frame rates, and the benefits of a Full-Frame sensor provides stunning performance and creative flexibility. The built-in Wi-Fi transmitter allows you to wirelessly transfer your images to social networking sites through CANON iMAGE GATEWAY, or upload virtually anywhere from your iOS or Android smartphone with the free download of the EOS Remote app.
